intro: Habranthus crassibulbus, commonly known as the broad-leaved habranthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its robust, grass-like foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its blooming period occurs during the summer months, producing clusters of vibrant yellow or orange flowers. Habranthus crassibulbus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
